original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽15.57. Savitakkaduka, Kusalattika🔽Savitakkaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasavitakko nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya  sa vitakka duka kusala ttika  sa vitakkam kusalam dhammam paṭicca na sa vitakkaḥ na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Triad🔽In the case of a wholesome state of consciousness accompanied by applied thought: There is resultant-ineffective consciousness with applied thought and without sustained thought, and there is the materiality derived by kamma performed in a wholesome state of consciousness accompanied by applied thought.🔽In the case of an unwholesome state of consciousness accompanied by applied thought: There is resultant-ineffective consciousness with applied thought and without sustained thought, and there is the materiality derived by kamma performed in an unwholesome state of consciousness accompanied by applied thought.

original: Savitakkaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasavitakko naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Abyākatamūlaṁ tīṇiyeva paccayavasena.)
analyzed: sa vitakkam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na sa vitakkaḥ na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi abyākata mūlam tīṇi eva paccaya vasena
translated: In the case of a state of consciousness that is indeterminate and has a root-cause that is indeterminate: There is resultant-ineffective consciousness with applied thought and without sustained thought, and there is the materiality derived by kamma performed in a state of consciousness that is indeterminate and has a root-cause that is indeterminate.
